data.title: The Cable Guy - Movie Reviews
data.meta_description: Rotten Tomatoes, home of the Tomatometer, is the most trusted measurement of quality for Movies & TV. The definitive site for Reviews, Trailers, Showtimes, and Tickets
data.text:
...on the whole The Cable Guy is about as subversive a mainstream comedy as youâ€™ll find...

Full Review | Original Score: 2/4 | Jun 14, 2022

As with Reality Bites two years earlier, director Stiller makes some astute observations about Generation X and its love of television - and media in general.

Full Review | Original Score: 3.5/5 | Jul 20, 2021

The hook to this weirdly compelling film is its teasing nature as a comedy of terrors.

Full Review | Original Score: 3.5/5 | May 12, 2020

Sure, in the title role [Carrey] plays another in-your-face, over-the-top, wild and crazy guy. But for once he is not a lovable goof. He is a rather unsavory psychotic. And the movie itself is not pure farce: it is satire, with a disturbing edge.

Full Review | Mar 22, 2019

The Cable Guy is a gutsy move on Carrey's part, suggesting a willingness to grow just where commercial good sense would say to stand pat.

Full Review | Original Score: 3/4 | Mar 11, 2019

As a supposed summer blockbuster, this is a very eccentric film: The Cable Guy mocks its star as a pathetic jerk and comes close to telling its audience that we are, too.

Full Review | Mar 11, 2019

Those who like enjoy seeing performers open up their ids in the name of comedy might get a kick out of Carrey's spooky malevolence. Others, however, enter at their own risk.

Full Review | Original Score: B- | Mar 11, 2019

It barely matters that The Cable Guy fails [to satirize TV], because it is crammed with other pleasures, not least Carrey, who lets us glimpse the human being behind the sociopath.

Full Review | Dec 12, 2018

Carrey's life-of-a-bad-party manner is a major hoot as he toys with Broderick over legal and illegal installations.

Full Review | Original Score: 3/4 | Dec 12, 2018

To watch Carrey leering with joy at the prospect of making respectable people guess dirty words, and Broderick trying to avoid the whole thing, is to enjoy their best comic synergy.

Full Review | Dec 12, 2018

In the hands of a smart director like Stiller, Carrey pushes his acting career to a new level here. The question is whether the comic's less daring fans are willing to go there with him.

Full Review | Original Score: 2.5/4 | Dec 12, 2018

[The Cable Guy] is so repellent as to be almost literally unwatchable. This comedy isn't dark, it's extinguished. It isn't entertainment, it's pathology.

Full Review | Dec 12, 2018

More than anything, The Cable Guy is simply uncomfortable. It's Ace Ventura as the evil bad guy.

Full Review | Original Score: 2/4 | Dec 12, 2018
